title: How to Roast Spaghetti Squash

methods.name: Spaghetti Squash with Herbs and Parmesan

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (204 degrees C).
steps.description: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil or coat with a non-stick cooking spray.

steps.headline: Brush the open side of each piece of squash with olive oil.
steps.description: Place the squash skin-side up on the baking sheet and cook in the oven for about 45 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from oven and allow to cool for 3-5 minutes.
steps.description: Squash should be tender and lightly browned when finished. Use a fork to scrape out the inside of each piece in long, spaghetti-like strands.

steps.headline: Mix together olive oil, parmesan cheese, parsley, cilantro and hazelnuts in a small bowl.
steps.description: Toss the mixture with the spaghetti squash, and add salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
steps.description: Lightly grease a baking sheet or line with aluminum foil.

steps.headline: Place spaghetti squash skin-side up on the baking sheet.
steps.description: Cook for 50 minutes or until tender. Use a knife or fork to determine whether the squash is finished.

steps.headline: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
steps.description: Add the onion and the garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in tomatoes and cook for an additional 3-5 minutes.

steps.headline: Use a fork to scrape out the insides of each piece of squash.
steps.description: The pulp should come out in long, stringy pieces. Place in a mixing bowl.

steps.headline: Toss with the cooked vegetables, feta cheese, olives, and basil.
steps.description: Add olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste.

text: Spaghetti Squash with Herbs and Parmesan Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (204 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil or coat with a non-stick cooking spray. Brush the open side of each piece of squash with olive oil. Place the squash skin-side up on the baking sheet and cook in the oven for about 45 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 3-5 minutes. Squash should be tender and lightly browned when finished. Use a fork to scrape out the inside of each piece in long, spaghetti-like strands. Mix together olive oil, parmesan cheese, parsley, cilantro and hazelnuts in a small bowl. Toss the mixture with the spaghetti squash, and add salt and pepper to taste. Serve and enjoy!  Greek-Style Spaghetti Squash Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet or line with aluminum foil. Place spaghetti squash skin-side up on the baking sheet. Cook for 50 minutes or until tender. Use a knife or fork to determine whether the squash is finished. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and the garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in tomatoes and cook for an additional 3-5 minutes. Use a fork to scrape out the insides of each piece of squash. The pulp should come out in long, stringy pieces. Place in a mixing bowl. Toss with the cooked vegetables, feta cheese, olives, and basil. Add olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste. Serve immediately and enjoy!
